alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Braxton; Clay; Gilmer; Harrison; Kanawha; Lewis; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Taylor; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 28 at 7:58AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT RANDOLPH...EAST CENTRAL KANAWHA... UPSHUR...WEBSTER...BARBOUR...SOUTHEASTERN HARRISON...POCAHONTAS... NICHOLAS...TAYLOR...EAST CENTRAL GILMER...LEWIS...BRAXTON...CLAY AND CENTRAL FAYETTE COUNTIES... At 751 AM EST, scattered snow showers were moving across the area with gusty winds and lowering visibility. Motorists should be prepared for rapidly deteriorating conditions. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling. In addition, temperatures will drop into the mid to upper 20s this morning. Icy roads are possible as the initial snow melts on the roads then quickly refreezes. Conditions are expected to improve later this morning. However, slicks spots may linger into the early afternoon. Locations impacted include... Clarksburg, Elkins, Buckhannon, Grafton, Weston, Summersville, Philippi, Fayetteville, Richwood, Rainelle, Marlinton, Sutton, Clay, Greenbank, Audra State Park, Webster Springs, Cass Scenic Railroad, Babcock State Park, Bridgeport, and Belington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 46 and 128. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 81 and 82. Route 19 between mile markers 18 and 68. Route 33 between mile markers 1 and 35.
